title: ISS finishes initial iROSA upgrade with two EVAs this month
summary:
The International Space Station’s iROSA (ISS Roll-Out Solar Array) solar panel upgrade, started in 2021, has finished its initial upgrade plan with the successful installation of the last two arrays this month. The arrays for the 1A and 1B power channels were brought to ISS aboard the CRS-28 Cargo Dragon flight and then installed in a pair of EVAs by NASA astronauts Steve Bowen and Woody Hoburg.

The iROSA project was started due to the ongoing degradation of the Station’s existing solar panels after years in low-Earth orbit. The original solar array complement, finished in March 2009 with the installation of the S6 truss, was capable of 240 kilowatts when new. However, the radiation environment in orbit has degraded the arrays to the point where they can now only generate 160 kilowatts.

title: ESA Reserve Astronaut Secures Seat Aboard Axiom Flight
summary:
The European Space Agency has announced that astronaut reserve Marcus Wandt will fly aboard an Axiom Space flight to the International Space Station. With the announcement, Wandt has become the first of the newest ESA astronaut class to secure a seat on a spacecraft heading for space. ESA opened up applications for a new class […]
The post ESA Reserve Astronaut Secures Seat Aboard Axiom Flight appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Project Kuiper urges regulators to focus on satellite maneuverability rules
summary: Governments should consider requiring satellites over a certain altitude to be maneuverable to improve space sustainability, according to an executive for Amazon’s proposed Project Kuiper constellation.

title: Investing in Space: Bankers and insiders say M&A action is heating up
summary: The space sector has seen a variety of mergers and acquisitions since the start of the year, but the deal-making is only heating up.

title: Former top SpaceX lawyer joins Surf Air Mobility as it prepares to go public
summary: David Anderman, who recently served as SpaceX general counsel, is joining soon-to-be-public company Surf Air Mobility, CNBC has learned.

title: Former Spaceflight CEO joins law firm to support commercial space clients
summary: The former chief executive of Spaceflight has joined a major law firm to lead its efforts in supporting the commercial space industry.

title: Luxembourg approves program to give NATO O3b mPower access
summary: SES said June 15 that Luxembourg has approved a program to carve out capacity from its O3b mPower medium Earth orbit broadband network for the country and NATO allies.

title: More countries encouraged to commit to halt destructive ASAT tests
summary: Despite an overwhelming vote of support by the United Nations General Assembly six months ago, advocates of a moratorium on one type of anti-satellite tests say they are still working to get more countries to adopt it.

title: For the first time in decades, Congress seems interested in space-based solar power
summary: "We already know from early research that it is possible."

title: Space Force working to define what it means to be a guardian
summary: Amid the growing pains that come with being a new military branch, the U.S. Space Force is trying to establish its brand and build an identity.
